channel.title: Making axoloti an hardware patchable synth?
channel.description:
Hi there, First post for me. After some years of using the axoloti with a usb keyboard, i begin to solder pots and stuff on a new box i'm working on. So i came across this idea. Looking at the input/output map of the beast, i couldn't help but think : would it be possible to make actual patch points on the box, linked to the GPIO of the board? Using small cords like the ones in the AE modular synth (read breadboard cables).
So am i crazy/stupid? Or would it be doable. And if so, which ones to choose from? any one of the digital in/digital outs? Or just the ones which are analog ins? I hope all of it makes sense.
Keep on noodling,
Eric

item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

Maybe there is a hint in here:

Semi-modular hardware patch bay? Hardware
Is it possible to wire up a semi-modular patch bay like many of Bastl Instruments' synths have? [image] Is this something that the GPIO ports can do, or would extra components be required? There's just something really fun about plugging stuff together physically rather than turning knobs on a controller.

I like the idea too..
